column2: This is the blood of Raton the Radiant, who over the course of his life contemplated different faiths before settling on the Edenite religion. On his conversion he founded the shortlived Kingdom of Yellowstone.

Reserves revolve around the relationship between mankind and nature, focusing on reciprocity instead of exploitation. They exist on the premise that nature is sacred, and that any unnecessary intrusion by mankind is an affront to the divine. Favoring scattered camps and strongholds over large expansive settlements, preserves seek to conserve the land to prevent destruction whether at the hands of men or by some unforeseen cataclysm.
